moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. e5: The Advance variation against the French Defense.
moves.3... c5 4. Qg4: I had just read about this move Qh4 but never played against it. There are some real problems for White in this line.
moves.4... cxd4 5. Nf3 Nc6 6. Bd3 Qc7 7. Qg3 N: A pawn was lost but he avoided other problems---for the moment.
moves.15... Qxf4+ 16. Kb1 O-O 17. Bxf6: Bxf6? is another poor move weakening the black squares.
moves.19. bxc3 Rac8: Doubled isolated pawns couldn't be avoided. The busted up castled position is about to lose the game for White.
Ng5 is worth a try but now we have...
moves.24. g4 Rc4xc3 25. Qd4 Rc8c4: Now forced moves will tell the story..
moves.26. Qe5 Qb4+ 27. Ka1 Rc3xc2 28. Rdb1 Rxa: The White king did not have an adequate defense and exchanging off the Bishop earlier proved to be the deciding factors.
